ticket.original-body:
Runtime errors in the development environment typically render a rescue page that shows the error, extracted source, various traces, request and response parameters. Starting with commit [841c01fa0fa92aa6e3c2e5029444a9cbb4f161f3](http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/841c01fa0fa92aa6e3c2e5029444a9cbb4f161f3), a 500 Internal Server Error is produced instead unless there is no data involved.
Reproduction [scenario](http://intertwingly.net/stories/2010/05/05/no_method_error.out): generate an app, generate a model w/scaffold, insert an error into index.html, fetch the index (and see the rescue page), create an instance of the model, and refetch the index.
[testcase](http://intertwingly.net/stories/2010/05/05/no_method_error.rb), [output](http://intertwingly.net/stories/2010/05/05/no_method_error.html), [bisect](http://intertwingly.net/stories/2010/05/05/bisect.log)
